website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option for those seeking a solid, compact keyboard but really don’t need or want backlighting.
pros: We love the sound and feel of the Blue switches
The compact form is a hit with many
cons: The compact form is due to the fact that there is no number pad, which may turn off some buyers
Some report that keyboard is not water resistant

customer_reviews.title: The Clicks And Clacks Are TOO Real!
customer_reviews.text: Price, size, and most of all... The perfect clicky sounds!! It feels very sturdy AND heavy too, quite surprising actually (could prob the TV/monitor when rage quitting and this will still work) Only con is it woul've been nice if the cord was braided  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄ If you like the clickity clack of a keyboard then id highly recommend this. *note: I'm not a keyboard connoisseur, so I can't compare that of the premium cherry mx blue keys nor argue that reds/browns are better for gaming due to lower accentuating force... but as a console pleb tryhard, you can bet typing this review was an absolute pleasure
customer_reviews.author: Hanjo

customer_reviews.title: worth its price, pictures lie about keycaps font
customer_reviews.text: this one is definitely worth its price. it's well-built, minimalistic and very solid keyboard. *pros*: 1. price (definitely worth); 2. style (i like minimalism); 3. quality (feels solid); 4. rubber front pads (do not slip on desk); 5. rubber legs (no slip when inclined) *cons*: 1. keycaps font (i really liked the font on photos and it was one of the reasons i've bought specifically this one, notone); 2. fn key is located on the right (it's a matter of habbit, but all laptops have it on the left and it's easier to switch back-and-forth) *one thing to consider*: it's noisy, really noisy, for some it may be a disadvantage. i personally like how it sounds.
customer_reviews.author: abetaev

customer_reviews.title: Fading key caps  and  buggy USB controller ruin an otherwise decent keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I guess you really do get what you pay for. I wanted to like this keyboard. But after only 3 days of use the printed characters on key caps are starting to "rub off". Also, the USB controller is buggy. I use linux and had to enable the HID quirks driver, otherwise putting the computer to sleep and then waking it, the keyboard stops working. Both of these issues are a shame, because the switches and chassis of the keyboard seems to be of reasonable quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eggbert

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but the letters rub off
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it's not a bad keyboard at all and the price is great. That said, the letters wore off really quickly, so if you need to look at the letters, it might not be the best fit. Also, just in case you didn't notice, it's a smaller keyboard; there is no number pad out to the right. I have a small desk, and I don't use those keys, so this is not an issue to me, but I know it is to some people. It also feels a little bit smaller (as in closer together / smaller keys) than the old school dell keyboard I use in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Durable, well made, love the cliticky clack...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a narrower keyboard without a number pad built in for writing. (I'm not a gamer.) I wanted a keyboard that was heavy duty, inexpensive but not 'cheap'. That's what I got with this and I'm very happy with my purchase. This is my first mechanical keyboard, and after writing with it I will never buy a standard keyboard again. I feel like every keystroke is substantial and typing with it is a joy to me when compared to my other, mushy feeling keyboard. And another plus, it has 'weight' and feels substantial. I was very surprised of the build quality for the price. Very good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: BCTolbert

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, amazing price
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing for typing and gaming. Price is great (because it uses imitation switches) and it really makes you wonder if it is worth paying for the original ones. So far, after three months, I haven't had any issues with the keys or space bar. The keyboard is heavy, feels sturdy on your desk and doesn't look tacky like other gaming keyboards. I really like the size and I don't mind losing the numeric keypad. I prefer a narrow keyboard that allows you to place the mouse closer to the center of the desk. My only complain is that it is not backlit, but I bought it knowing that. Maybe the next version will include backlit non-rgb keys.
customer_reviews.author: William R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Connection issues
customer_reviews.text: I have an issue with the keyboard connecting and disconnecting often, sometimes during games. It will be fine for a few days then suddenly go through a series of disconnects. It does it on every usb port on my computer and it also did it on my laptop. The keyboard itself is decent, in spite of no backlighting. It has a good feel in typing and has a standard layout. I'd actually give it a recommendation if it wasn't for, what I suspect, is a faulty usb connector.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hirst

customer_reviews.title: Hard to see key letters
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this keyboard may be good. My problem is that the lettering on the keys uses a weird font, and is very dim. I can barely read the letters. I regret buying this keyboard. [edit] I just realized the keyboard I was sent and the keyboard on the store page use a different font! The letters on the store page are also painted on, whereas the one I received are partially transparent, as if there are supposed to be little LED bulbs beneath each key. I guess it's too late to return the item now. (It has been 6 months.)
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so damn alright it makes the cavities in my teeth feel good. It's dense, it's small, it's kinda angry, so am I! Perfect for the price. I love being this loud places. I never thought I'd need a reason to get away from membrane keyboards. Hot poop, I was wrong. I know they're knock-switches, but I'm more comfortable with this little booger after 2 days then ANY keyboard I've ever had. My WPM went up at lease 17% day and date. I did receive this keyboard at a reduced rate, nor was it a gift. I bought this with my dollhairs. And if I could go back in time and buy it again, I would.
customer_reviews.author: B. S.

customer_reviews.title: What good is a warranty if there's no customer service?
customer_reviews.text: The backspace key stopped working after about 60 days of use. Customer service has yet to get back to me after 2 weeks. A real shame considering I bought it "NEW: 12-Month Worry-Free Warranty and Free Life-time Technical Support."
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: It is a mechanical keyboard but not using cherry switch, key-conflicting with each other.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to press 'qwertyui' at the same time but this 'TOMOKO 87 Non-conflict Keys Keyboard' gave my 'p2eqrtwy' which is really weird and I remove a cap to check the switch and realize it is not real blue switch. I was trying to code with this keyboard but I feel weird while using the backspace, it is too light for a blue switch. Some of the keys are too heavy or not smooth. Tbh, it should not worth $10 since I was comparing this keyboard with my friends who got one in China with 99rmb = $15. That Made-in-China keyboard are using real Cherry MX black switch and it can change every single switch.
customer_reviews.author: Yubin Fu

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you are pretty hesitant buying an obscure brand keyboard. This is one of the better keyboards I've ever purchased, regardless of price. I'd highly recommend it.I go through a ton of keyboards. This is one of my favorites. Before purchasing this keyboard, however, one needs to understand that Blue Switches ARE LOUD. There's no way of getting around that without compromising the feel of the switch. Also, the packaging was very nice for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cojo

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I've never had blue switches before and I love the clickiness of this keyboard! The build is quality is solid no flex at all and it weight hold it in place (that may also be the rubberized feet) Only regret is i wish it was backlit. the keycaps seem to be designed for backlit which just tease me everytime I look at them.
customer_reviews.author: ASATX

customer_reviews.title: So far, so very good
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review on this keyboard, as a bit of a test-run as I haven't yet had any extended typing to do since receiving it. My initial impressions are as follows. I should note that I'm not a mechanical keyboard aficionado, but these keys feel great. The key travel feels very natural and the switches actuate and rebound very crisply. The chassis of the keyboard is metal and feels very solid overall. Ergonomics of the key layout is very good. Overall, I'm very pleased with the purchase and doubly so at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: its ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is extremely loud. I can't imagine typing on it for very long. Even thought I knew it wasn't backlit, the lettering on the keys, which is white, is extremely faint. In a well lighted room, you have to look closely for that one key. The keyboard is small. A standard sized keyboard is 18". This is 14". I'm returning this and getting a better, more expensive keyboard. And with a 10 key.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: The feel of this keyboard is great and the price was right to just try out ...
customer_reviews.text: The feel of this keyboard is great and the price was right to just try out a mechanical keyboard for the first time. My wife complains that there is no numberpad (I didn't realize this when I ordered it originally) but that doesn't bother me. I just glossed over that when I looked at the picture. The sound isn't too loud...reminds me of a typewriter. I like that. The feel is just great, though. The keys are a bit more raised than a membrane keyboard, but that only takes a little getting used to. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jameson & Deirdre Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Best Accessory for my MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard to help increase my typing speed and accuracy. I was a little hesitant since I feared there may be a compatibility issue with my MacBook Air. All I did was plug it in, and my typing increased from roughly 65 WPM to well over 90 WPM. I love this keyboard so much! The keys are loud, but for me, that's part of the allure of a mechanical keyboard. The tactile and auditory feedback are what help me type so fast. My only regret is that I didn't order this keyboard sooner. Also, the price I paid is absolutely amazing considering I've seen other mechanical keyboards priced well over $100.
customer_reviews.author: David Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Keyboard. Not for ultra fast typists.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this keyboard is great! It dosn't have the number pad so it saves me space on my desk. I like the Mechanical switches they are more clicky than my Cherry Red's, it's more like Cherry blue Switches. I've had multiple kids use this keyboard to play minecraft it's been dropped so many times and has held up well. I find that it's N-Key rollover function is lacking. I frequently have to slow down when I am typing passwords or it will miss characters.
customer_reviews.author: EvilBob

customer_reviews.title: Great value mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My first mechanical, been using membrane for years. Really surprised at the quality of this. If you switched like me you'll notice -it's a lot easier to press the keys (needs about half the force) = less fatigue -it weighs a lot more, so it stays in place. But this means less portable -your typing speed will increase due to clicky feedback Feels really sturdy, so no question about durability (will update if I run into problems). Really reminds me of old style keyboards. If you are serious about typing or will use for computer a lot, I highly recommend one of these. Plus it's really fun. PS Not a paid reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: davidtriune

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me except the noise
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great and perfect in every respect but one. It's WAY too noisy. I didn't need it for gaming, but it was the only one I could find that was small enough for my small hands that I could use for work. I have a lot of conference calls, and I cannot hear anyone on the phone above the noise of the keyboard when taking notes. Wish it was silent - I'd rate it all five stars otherwise. Sadly, returning it and hoping the next best one I found will work out.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Nice but very cheap. 2 bad keys in the first couple months.
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard but I guess I got what I paid for. I have had two keys go bad. So I had to pull the board apart and de-solder the number 8 key and the up arrow key and swap them out with the "scroll lock" and "pause/break" key. Aside from that its a good board. But I'm sure most people are not capable of pulling the board apart and performing a professional quality repair.
customer_reviews.author: T P

customer_reviews.title: Solid build with quality switches
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard has a really solid build. The key caps are smoother on my old Quickfire TK. Fortunately I was able to swap most of the keycaps from my malfunctioning Quickfire onto this keyboard(except the last row). The switch are loud and clickey. Feels almost like a cheery green mx but doesn't need that much force. I really like this keyboard hope it's gonna last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kin

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It has the feel I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard and, so far, I love it. It has the feel I was looking for and all the features I wanted but at a pretty good price. Granted, I'm sure those with a lot of experience with these kinds of keyboards, they won't like it as much as their top dollar cherry MX keyboards but for me, I'm loving it. I'm also really happy about the size of it because I don't have much room and never really used the number pad on my other keyboards anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Maumbah

customer_reviews.title: Tough to beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been keyboarding for a very long time now. Like many long-timers, I failed to notice the gradual degradation in the quality of keyboards over the years; it was fairly subtle from generation to generation. I tossed a *lot* of keyboards I should have kept. Now I'm gonna throw out a few more. :) I didn't think I *needed* a decent mechanical keyboard -- I was wrong. I'm not a gamer, so I can't say how suitable this model is for that. But for daily, all-day coding, this is a marked improvement over the crappy rubber-domes I'd acclimated to. Update: I bought another one. Hey it looks like the price went up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Steve, Steve Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great keys, not easy to configure for Mac
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't plug and play for me on Mac. I've formed a habit of using the function keys on Mac to control music volume, pause/play, switch songs, and adjust brightness. I can't figure out how to configure the Mac to handle these. I tried an app and also played with the keyboard settings. Was able to get brightness but couldn't find the settings for music control. I love the mechanical feel of the keyboard and have decided to go with a $100 Mac-specific mechanical keyboard which also has a number pad and supposedly works out-of-the-box for the function keys I use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great use but lasted 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: It just stopped working for me today. I've only had it for one year. I tried it with different computers and laptops, and it's definitely not working. I only used it approximately 15 times since purchase. Not sure what caused it to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well put together this keyboard is for the price. They keycaps on mine are double shot injected! Incredible! It has a nice heft to it and the actual key switches are pretty nice. I've only had one minor issue with the shift key occasionally not being recognized when I hit it but that could easily be an issue with my mediocre work computer.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer Parents

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard 👌 with a great price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a budget mechanical keyboard for gaming, wasn't looking for anything fancy and this keyboard doesn't disappoint. it feels awesome to type on and gaming feels so much more responsive. if you like super loud, clicky keys then this keyboard is for you because these keys are super loud lol. I also have a victsing mouse pad if anyone is wondering what the keyboard and mouse pad look like together. very good keyboard for the price!
customer_reviews.author: dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard for a reasonable price -- note: no number pad.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice mechanical keyboard for the price. It doesn't feel like a million bucks, but it certainly feels like more than $30. I can type at full speed on this thing. One thing to note: IT DOES NOT COME WITH A NUMBER PAD. Most people probably don't use one; but if you enter special characters using ASCII codes, you just can't do that without a number pad. You can pick up an add-on mechanical number pad for about $18 on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard for work. (My desk job luckily does not require to type much or any numbers.) Love the way it feels as I type and with that my keystrokes are a lot more fluid as opposed to a standard keyboard. The number pad being removed from the right side also provides extra space for modern day office life, as most companies are looking to minimize space.
customer_reviews.author: George T

customer_reviews.title: My son took my first one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase! The keyboard is made of quality material. My son took the first keyboard I purchased and is using it for his games. The keyboard feels great and sounds great too. Cherry MX Blues are the way to go. Being a tkl keyboard, it saves a lot of space, and it has a sleek design as well. It doesn't have any flashy lights, but for the price, this is one of the best purchases you can make. Highly recommend this product to anyone who doesn't mind the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Elie

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the money - click click click
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a couple of weeks now. I have a red keyboard at home, so this is a different experience for this work keyboard. It's certainly not quiet, though I didn't expect that. The keys have a good feel, and are mostly uniform across the keyboard. The only negative I have found is that the letters on the keyboard are going to wear off quickly. I'm a computer programmer so I type a lot, but still, for only having this for about 3 weeks, there certainly isn't longevity in the lettering. I never look at the keys so I don't care, but may be something for you to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise this board is fantastic, feels great but kinda loud (expected for cherry ...
customer_reviews.text: Letters on keys wear off almost immediately (WASD is already heavily faded after one weekend of light gaming use), though that's not that big of an issue if you know how to type. Otherwise this board is fantastic, feels great, kinda loud (expected for cherry blue copies). This board has some really cool features like volume, pause/play, skip forward/backward, and calculator short cut button along with being able to lock the windows button so you don't bump it when you don't need it. 10/10, thinking of buying another to keep in reserve when this one eventually breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is so different from what comes with a PC nowadays! It's more like what came with the original IBM PC back in 1990 or so. It has a solid feel, it's made of heavy metal, and it has that clicky sound and feel. I'm a programmer not a gamer, but I like this one. I like that it has the keys in the standard spacing for fast touch typing, but it not so huge on my desk. The only thing not perfect is that it's much thicker (taller) than most modern keyboards. So I got a wrist rest to use with it. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: An Anita fan

customer_reviews.title: An Improvement Over Many Keyboards
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard printing appears to be chincy (yes chincy). It is ok. Is easily readable. Just no pleasant. I will say overall very well constructed. That said the keyboard is designed for a small set of hands. If you have large hands the keyboard is very problematic. Some reviewers rave about the feel. I think the feel of the keys is a big improvement over non-mechanical keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great quality build for the price. Avoid if you REALLY are used to back lights though.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Nice solid build. Has a great mechanical clacking sound. Thought I could live without backlight, but as most of my use is late at night or early in the morning, I really MISS backlights. Also didn't notice that it was a short and not full keyboard as it's missing a num pad and associated key section, but meh. If it really irks me enough I'll just pick up a detached numpad.
customer_reviews.author: D.z

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard works pretty well, and the cap puller is useful if ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works pretty well, and the cap puller is useful if you ever want to get in there. That said, you get what you pay for and this is pretty bare bones. I'd say to go with a more full function keyboard if you're really wanting a daily driver keyboard. DO NOT buy this if you're looking to get a clicky keyboard for work. It IS very loud and if you're in any kind of open environment, your coworkers will probably hate you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best budget mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Had this keyboard for a month now, by far one of the best budget keyboards I have purchased. If you are looking to get into mechanical keyboards but have a tight budget and want a clean looking keyboard this is definitely the one to go for. I would recommend getting replacement keycaps since the lettering on the stock keycaps will come off in a week. It is advertised as sold, truly water resistant as I have rinsed off the keyboard after accidently spilled soda onto my keyboard. Great keyboard for typing on and gaming with.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Yap

customer_reviews.title: really good for the money, legit mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wasn't expecting much, considering it's only about $36 at the time of this writing, but man I'm really impressed with the overall quality of the product. Very heavy and solid feeling, no worries about budging or moving on a desk at all, the keys are fast and relatively light with a nice clickity clak. This keyboard is very tall though, which is the same as most other mechanical keyboards, i'd recomend getting a wrist pad if you don't have one already, I'm planning on picking one up now.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J.

customer_reviews.title: Solid & affordable
customer_reviews.text: I followed the reviews for a mechanical keyboard that fit the budget, and I'm impressed. I don't know of a higher-quality product that doesn't use Cherry MX keyswitches. I missed the number pad that I've grown accustomed to with other keyboards, so I got a Jelly Roll numeric keypad to accompany this. (This isn't a critique of the product, of course, but rather a suggestion to anyone who's partial to a numpad.)
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Washington

customer_reviews.title: Not Cherry Blues, But Incredible for Price!
customer_reviews.text: This does not feel like a cherry blue switch keybaord exactly. There is a bit more resistance, and the clicks are slightly more 'tinny'. That being said there is absolutely nothing wrong with typing on this keyboard. It feels very mechanical and smooth, and has a heavyweight high quality feel. For the price, ~$25 at the time, this keyboard seems absolutely unbeatable and compares to much more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: SH22

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level mechanical keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for $27.99 as a Prime member after a friend alerted me to an $8-off promo code (W43ZYTEY). This code was posted on early Dec. 2016, but you're welcome to try it out! To my disappointment, this lacks a number keypad, but this is a quality entry-level mechanical keyboard for the price. It's a bit loud, so I have to close my bedroom door whenever I use this at night (out of respect for my family members), but the construction is sturdy, nicely weighted, and well built. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Chi V.Top Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Keys going bad after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Almost 1 year after purchase, keys are starting to go bad. I need to press really hard on a few keys to get them to work. I use this keyboard as my work office keyboard, but I travel a lot for work. So I don't use it THAT much. I have to leave 1 star because keyboards should last for like a decade at least. And this thing is seeing minimal use compared to my Logitech I have at home, which has been fine for 8 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard. I have spent 3-4 times more on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard. I have spent 3-4 times more on big name gaming keyboards, and this one is of the same quality - if not better. EDIT 7/8/16: I have only had this keyboard since about June 10th and the lettering on the keys is starting to fade. Not a deal breaker, I still like the keyboard, but disappointing to say the least... I have had keyboards for 10+ years and the letters never even began to fade... One month?? Come on..
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, regardless of the price.
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not write reviews for a product unless i am really impressed. This keyboard is awesome and that is why i am writing this review. This is my first ever mechanical keyboard and I love it. The keyboard is compact and feels heavy and sturdy. The keys are feels light to press and very clicky. This keyboard is very loud, i love the clicky noise but I wouldn't use it in an office without o-rings to dampen the noise. I initially hesitated on the purchase because most of the reviews were by customers who received the keyboard for the purpose of writing a review, I am glad that I took the chance because this keyboard is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Li

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic budget mechanical keyboard. BUT you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind you're going to get what you pay for. At this price it's an amazing deal and far superior to most membrane keyboards. That said it's a bit loud and the action isn't anywhere as nice as my other mechanical keyboard but that one cost over $150. I wouldn't buy this for the office or any shared space but for someone who doesn't have to worry about disturbing people it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1.5 years, but no longer
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this keyboard back in 2016 and it worked flawlessly for about a year and a half. About 6 month ago some keys (like 'B', 'X', 'Z', 'V') started to work unreliably, I have to press them significantly harder to get them do anything. The more I use it the worse it gets. Need to replace with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Art17

customer_reviews.title: Got a used product
customer_reviews.text: Can clearly see that WASD keys were used. The paint on them is off and I can see fingerprints.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Feels good to type on this. But, not for quiet office environment.  Very noisy, but pleasure to type.
customer_reviews.text: As some reviewers say, letters look like they 'may' wear off easily. But, if you do not really care about that (lot of people know what each key is even if there is no printing on it). Numbers will not wear off much as they are not used very frequently like alphabets keys (at least from what I have observed). For the price, great keyboard. But, do not think about using in an office environment. They are very noisy. If you work from home office, you likely will love to type on this.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Feels good, looks nice and is holding up well
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid keyboard. The size, I thought I wouldn't like, but is actually really good. Feels nice a sturdy, typing is satisfying and never lags no matter how fast I type. Haven't spilled anything on it so I can't attest to how water resistant it is. But if you're looking for a decently priced mechanical keyboard, then look no further. This is a solid buy for entry level.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this keyboard for $30. Pros: Actual mechanical switches. And they're loud. Which is what I wanted. Some may not like it. They feel great to type on. The face plate is actual metal. The board is pretty heavy and feels more premium than I was expecting Comes with a keycap puller Key caps should be interchangeable with Cherry compatible caps (I haven't tested this, the post appears very similar) Cons: Some of the keys sound different Not name brand switches (but you know that going in) Overall it feels like a solid keyboard. Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Super durable, responsive, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a steal. I’ve used it for my personal and work all day long for a couple years. There has been no signs of wear, it is tough and very easy to type fast for work and responds very well for gaming. So glad I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Hands!
customer_reviews.text: The TOMOKO Mechanical Keyboard has saved my hands - and my career. I'm a professional writer. Before I purchased this product, I had almost constant pain and stiffness in both hands. I had started to rely on voice-to-text software to get through big jobs with big deadlines! That is no longer the case. I can type easily for long periods with no ill effects. If you write or program for a living, I highly recommend this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Clackity-Clack
customer_reviews.text: Solid keyboard. Really like the feel and the function. This is very close to one of the keyboards that I really loved from many years ago and it brings back good memories. Didn't need the back-lighting of the more expensive version nor the numeric keypad. This fits my work space better than the 101 keys and my bride has adapted quickly. Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!!
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions were great out of the box. Has a great feel and build. Advertised as water proof so will help with accident spills should they occur. It was only when I compared next to my cooler master keyboard that I could feel a difference in quality. Then again this was 5 times cheaper. I bought this to fit in a specific area on a server rack and it works great and was cheaper than any keyboard without a number pad I could find and was mechanical to boot.
customer_reviews.author: bcekli

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is outstanding. I like the look, clicking sounds, it brings back a time in the past of an old IBM keyboard. I have the most updated computer equipment (Windows/Mac) in my Video Studio, but yet, I’m still using wired keyboards and wired mouses/mice, even wired headsets, love the retro functionality. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard - Labeling Wears Easily
customer_reviews.text: This would have a five-star rating... however, within a week or so of using the keyboard, the printed labels on the keys began to wear off. The seller only offered $4 refund if I sent pictures- because it wasn't nearly enough to purchase a new key set, I didn't bother. However, everything else about the keyboard is great: the weight of the keyboard has a nice heft to keep it firmly planted, the mechanical keys offer good tactile feedback and the smaller size (no 10-key) allows my mouse to remain close to my hand.
customer_reviews.author: K.Y.

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is nice and clacky
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeing mechanical keyboards for a while, but I wanted something not too ostentatious for my office. I type a lot. This keyboard is nice and clacky, without being too loud. Typing is actually MORE FUN on this thing. It kinda sounds rhythmic when you type fast. This keyboard is compact, because there is no separate number pad. I might get another one for home...
customer_reviews.author: O.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for keyboard without number pad
customer_reviews.text: I am on PC all day, every day for work. I have been looking for a keyboard without number pad to use so that the mouse can be closer to the keyboard. There is not a wireless option that is suitable. This keyboard is affordable, and has a very nice touch. It does not require any software, just plug and play. I used the silicone rings to dampen the noise. I purchased a wireless number pad that I can use when needed ,but keep out of the way most of the time. This setup is a big improvement over traditional keyboard. My shoulder is thanking me that I don't reach over for the mouse anymore.
customer_reviews.author: smsmith

customer_reviews.title: Good (So Far). (Subject to change)
customer_reviews.text: I have to write this on an old $5 keyboard because the mechanical keyboard I bought will not work, something involving the cable I believe. If I'm lucky I will be able to disassemble it and effect repairs. If not, I suppose I could use it as a door stop. Update, after posting this I have been contacted by the seller with an offer for a replacement. Further Update: New keyboard arrived today, putting it through some paces here adding to the review. So far so good. Customer service has been very good with the replacement, there was no request to return the old keyboard, which is nice. Further updates at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cipponeri

customer_reviews.title: I find excellent. I just might buy another for my other ...
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say that the five stars is just my initial reaction from having this plugged in and working just minutes ago. But the tactile feedback and crispness of the keys, I find excellent. I just might buy another for my other shop system. I've been buying the IBM repro clicky keyboards in the past for around $80 each, but I find this one to be MUCH more to my satisfaction. Highly recommended from my own view and experience, but your own judgement might very well be different.
customer_reviews.author: iowahill

customer_reviews.title: Hope it holds up well long-term but it seems like it might
customer_reviews.text: For such an inexpensive keyboard, it seems surprisingly well constructed. Little to no keyboard flex, the key switches are snappy and responsive. The only downpoint is that the USB cable is hard-wired and not detachable, but I can forgo that in such an inexpensive keyboard. Hope it holds up well long-term but it seems like it might.
customer_reviews.author: J. Payne

customer_reviews.title: CLICK CLICK CLACK
customer_reviews.text: Feels like the keyboards for the 80's. The feedback and the clicking is awesome. I really enjoy typing on this guy. The key caps are fairly cheep, but seem passable. The bottom is made of metal and it seems solid. The cable is ample length, and it comes with a velcro loop. I am pleased with it. It is small enough I can fit in in my laptop bag (about the same width as a MBP) so I can drive people crazy at the coffee shop with continuous clicking.
customer_reviews.author: minni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mechanical keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mechanical keyboard for the price! This keyboard is VERY tactile - so yes its loud. When this first arrived, I used this for about a week straight with no issues - not long enough to gauge the letters rubbing off the key caps (This is my backup keyboard and/or travel keyboard for my laptop now) If you want a nice sleek no frills tactile mechanical keyboard, this is the one for the price! The cord is decent as well. The USB connector is gold plated too.
customer_reviews.author: slick

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to this new company and their keyboards!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is far too cheap for the quality it delivers! I've had for it a couple weeks and cannot believe the results. Years ago I had purchase the Razer mech keyboard for 4x the price of this one, and being completely honest when I say the comparability between the two are unbelievable close! I'm extremely pleased with the product and for the price, even if couple years down the road I need to replace, it's at a price you're able to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. This is actually my first mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Heh, typing on this keyboard as type this review. Very good product. This is actually my first mechanical keyboard, and I love it! Though, make sure you really read about the different kinds of switches. This has blue switches (the loudest). This keyboard is pretty loud. To combat the noise, I recommend purchasing some O-rings for the keys (can be found on Amazon). Double the rings on the keys you use frequently, and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard, Very responsive, Solid build, And feels very nice (Satisfying click noise, And solid travel force and distance). The keys are easily removable, but don't fall off without tugging (They provided a little red tool that easily pulls off the keys). And it requires no drivers to setup. It would be nice to have a tad bit more space, and perhaps back-lit keys, but for the price it really doesn't seem you can beat this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Erin A

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for gaming and office typing.
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple gaming computers, all with gaming keyboards, and I run a law practice as well. I have bought this keyboard twice and have really liked it. I have had the first one for a long time now, like 2 years, and it is great for gaming but even better for just typing generally.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Glen Earl

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but feels great on the fingers.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, but feels great on the fingers. I bought two of these for my nieces and they love them. The feel and clicking of the keys is great and the clicking also helps their mom know when they're up late playing on the computer when they shouldn't be. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Keycaps, Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Chinese knockoff switches have come a long way. This board feels great, and the sound and feel is consistent with every key. The only problem I have with it, is they keycaps are extremely cheap. They got shiny and unreadable in about 3 months of moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love this keyboard. I've only had it a day, but for the price, it's really excellent. Even if you don't get this one, get yourself a mechanical keyboard. It makes typing a joy again. I hope not to have any of the issues other reviewers describe later in it's lifetime but I will update the review if I do.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R Delp

customer_reviews.title: Keys losing their identity.
customer_reviews.text: Received Dec 2 by Dec 28 the white print on the keys was wearing off. See photos. Sorry to have to return because the touch and click are perfect. (5 keyboards in my home, none showing any wear on the keys. Two are over 8 years old.)
customer_reviews.author: Sedonartist

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic small heavy keyboard. It's great.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a keyboard with a "small footprint" to use for gaming from my couch. Something without the number pad and that has a clicky type feel. On my main PC I'm still using a mechanical ps2 IBM keyboard from 20 something years ago. I just like that old clicky response. Well this one definitely has that feel. Super clicky. Love it. Also it had some weight to it, nice and solid feeling. For 28 bucks, cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ty1er

customer_reviews.title: The opposite of ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: The keys are raised way too high and require too much force to press. The keys themselves are also too tall and curvy. I can barely reach 100 WPM and with much less accuracy compared to a Logitech K120 membrane keyboard from Wal-Mart. My comfortable typing speed is down from ~105 WPM to 80. The keyboard also has a weird curve to it that makes it harder to press the lower keys. Is this supposed to be ergonomic? It feels like they intentionally tried to make this keyboard as hard as humanly possible to type on. I'll probably be returning this. My wrists already hurt from typing this review.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: new keyboard more reliable
customer_reviews.text: Update: the seller got in contact with me and sent me another keyboard after I returned the first one. The new keyboards keys after more usage have not wiped off (they appeared to fade at first but they are better quality than the first ones). I had also bought another keyboard from razer but this I've feels so much better to type on. Overall, it's a great keyboard fro the price. Original: What is the use of a keyboard if you don't know what you're typing? The letters on the keys wipe off in a matter of hours.
customer_reviews.author: ArrowHead

customer_reviews.title: it feels strong and of good quality but thats it
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay keyboard. I guess its for real hard core gamers but i just wanted something that i could type tin that had big keys. Its too noisy but i guess thats why people buy it. it doesnt have a number pad on the side either. I will admit, it feels strong and of good quality but thats it. It doesnt have a backlight either, So if you are working in the dark... It will be hard to see
customer_reviews.author: Eleuterio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Its actually a really heavy keyboard. Actually impressed in ...
customer_reviews.text: Its actually a really heavy keyboard. Actually impressed in the build quality even after watching Linus Tech Tips and other youtube reviews. Wish there was a little more resistance in the keys but this is my first mechanical keyboard. So next time ill just get cherry mx brown or something. Lol
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Macs
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard, so I don't have much grounds for comparison. The first thing that struck me is how solid it feels. The weight surprised me. The keys are responsive and offer good feedback. In order to enable the home, pg up, pg down keys etc. you have to switch on the option "Use all F1, F2, etc. keys as standard function keys" under keyboard preferences in MacOS. I use the keyboard primarily for software development and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Perry E

customer_reviews.title: Blue for life!
customer_reviews.text: CLICKITY CLAKATY You choose a blue keyboard, you better know what you're signing up for. Considering I had been single for like 3 years I thought sure why not, but then like 1 week after getting I met someone who ended up becoming my gf. Is this relevant? Yes, I feel like a jerk because she takes naps and I game on this making more noise than an entire Internet Cafe. There is no moral to this story.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic keyboard! Impossible to beat for the price. Simple and clean design, and I like the smaller size of the board without the 10-key - this fits nicely in a keyboard tray alongside my mouse with the reclaimed space from not having a 10-key. Turned the spacebar upside down for a more ergonomic spacebar. This thing is great!
customer_reviews.author: Falciase

customer_reviews.title: it worked great,until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: It was loud but I knew that going in,I actually kind of liked the sound (probably not great for an office or quiet environment). It has been great otherwise,until now a year later. the Y key is failing,I sometimes have to slap the key hard 5 times to get it to register. That is not really acceptable in a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Writers best friend
customer_reviews.text: Could not be better. Nice "super clicky" feel and sound to the keys when typing. It is very satisfying to type on. Doesn't have the mushy feel that other non-mechanical keyboards do. I'm a writer and have always written first drafts by hand because I prefer the feel of pencil on paper. But I can actually write creatively with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan345

customer_reviews.title: Fully dropped it on concrete once while changing jobs and it wasn't damaged - just a few keys popped off and they were easy to pop back on
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't looking for much beyond the mechanical switch mechanism. Use it at work and it is a pleasure to type with. Loud, but in a satisfying way. Fully dropped it on concrete once while changing jobs and it wasn't damaged - just a few keys popped off and they were easy to pop back on.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Tabbert

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfying loud clicks, but letters get erased easily
customer_reviews.text: Too loud for office. I took it to work for a day and one colleague jokingly said he's glad it's his last day of work because of the rattling the keyboard made. Manager actually compared it to keyboard his father was using in the old days which in my opinion is a great plus. Great product for home office, and maybe if you want to show off somewhere. Feels very solid in build quality, love typing on it. The only minus is that letters get erased very easily by finger grease. I'm even thinking removing them completely to make a "stealth look"
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical Keyboard like any other
customer_reviews.text: Besides the benefits of it being a mechanical keyboard with multi-media keys, blue switches, and no numpad support (saves space if you don't use entirely), it also comes with a fairly low latency time. All is there with what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: broke in a week
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard worked well for about a week, then the spacebar started to go. two days later the entire thing stopped working. Reached out to the seller, saying it stopped working and it's been almost a week with no response. I'm having to go through amazon for a return, which is like pulling teeth because this item isn't "SOLD BY AMAZON". You've been warned, spend the 20 extra dollars and don't get a cheap chinese knockoff
customer_reviews.author: master of sa2b

customer_reviews.title: but this looks like a keeper
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is actually waterproof. This does not mean it is submerge-able though. I bought this, thinking that it would be a throwaway keyboard until I got an IBM model M clone, but this looks like a keeper! This is waterproof because all the holes are protected and sealed. The keys sound excellent, sort of like a cherry MX blue. I would buy this again if mine broke for some reason. Did I also mention? The back is made of steel or something. It sounds really great when the keys are pressed upon it.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Man

customer_reviews.title: A good mechanical keyboard for a good price
customer_reviews.text: The POV of a gamer: It's a good quality keyboard for a good price if you're looking for basic functions. I find nothing wrong with my keyboard. It's a small size, great if you don't have the usual desk setup for gaming. The Keys are pretty clunky and loud, louder than what I'm used to, but me I don't mind as it's kind of like an ASMR for me. And make sure the friends you chat with are okay with the sounds lol. Beside that, everything else is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dream Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Decent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that I have messed around for years with those other keyboards. I'm old and learned to type on a manual typewriter. I was fast and accurate but couldn't get the results I knew were possible until I purchased this keyboard. Now I'm back to almost (remember I'm old) as fast and accurate as I used to be before computers. I even love the clacking sound!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawna Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard yet so far :)
customer_reviews.text: I really like the mechanical keyboard and feel of clicking it comes with. This key keyboard works perfectly as designed and can't say anything wrong about it. I have been using it long by now and work like a charm not even a single problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: Simba

customer_reviews.title: Clickity-clack!
customer_reviews.text: I love the aesthetics, but my co-workers are less enthusiastic. I got rubber rings to make the keys quieter. The switches still click, but the rubber rings prevent the keys from bottoming out against the metal frame.
customer_reviews.author: Hydraxan14

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good keyboard for the price. i recommend it. but it can be annoying with the sound. I also haven't had it very long and i can notice the white bold numbering and lettering on my "wasd" starting to fade. that i feel is the only cheap part of the keyboard. it can mean a big difference for some, but for me it really doesn't bother me all that much. 9/10
customer_reviews.author: wesley hussey

customer_reviews.title: Great feel!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and the way the keys click. I’m not a gamer, I just type a lot every day. The whole blue versus red switches is moot because at this price I’m sure they’re cheapo switches. But it feels so good it doesn’t matter.
customer_reviews.author: Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Keys are not working after a month of use .......
customer_reviews.text: nice and small BUT keys are starting not to work on it just after a moth of having it kinda sucks good price but not worth it if it only last just over a month before you have to replace it........
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: DAS broke, this much better!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so upset when my DAS keyboard quit working after two years. But the Tomoko with no num pad is incredible. Anyone who types on it wants one! Better size, weight, and price. Thankful I read the reviews and found what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.author: Karla Riley

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard disconnects opening certain programs
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is great very comfortable and responsive one problem that i'm sure if it's my computer or the keyboard sometimes when i open steam it reconnects making the disconnecting sound this doesn't happen a lot and sometimes if i open a game to try to open full screen for like a game or close out of full screen it reconnects and once it reconnected several times during the time it did that the keyboard didn't work at all but it does happen pretty rarely
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Stunned, Great budget keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: was not expecting this level of build quality on this keyboard, pleasantly surprised. metal backplate, responsive/tactile keys with minimal play. Spacing of the keys is tighter than most, resulting in the keyboard being even smaller than portrayed in the image. Keyboard is quite heavy for its size, making it feel almost premium. Only thing now is to see if it will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good switch and feels nice.
customer_reviews.text: Typing on the keyboard for about 4 months now and its very good. Replace the key caps with some better ones and boom you have a solid keyboard for under 70$.
customer_reviews.author: Deleted

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: Has a strange driver issue that causes it to randomly disconnect and re connect during games
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. The response and feedback are amazing. The chord is thick and high quality, the case is fairly hefty for a small keyboard (which is a plus to me) Although the keys were louder than I thought they might be I do not mind. This is a great one for the price and definitely a great first mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Semp

product_meta.title: VicTsing Mechanical Keyboard, Wired Gaming keyboard with Blue Switches, 87 Keys Anti-Ghosting, 12 Multimedia Shortcuts, Waterproof Keyboard for PC and Laptop-Black
product_meta.description:
Clicky Feedback
Using blue switches, it delivers a satisfying audio feedback of every single click. Help you take full control over your game and experience a new level of gaming.

Media Shortcuts
Give you a quick access to dedicated media controls, such as volume, play, pause, next and previous track, calculator, email, web browser etc.

Durable
Keys can bear 50 million times keystrokes. Made of metal material, with matte-finish texture, it is sturdy and robust enough to protect it from scratch , bump and corrosion.

Complimentary Key Cap Puller Tool 
We offer you a key cap puller for free. With this gadget, you can pull your key caps easily when you want to clean your keyboard or frequently change your key caps.

Non-slip Design
Under the keyboard, there are two rubberized holders to prevent it from slip.

There are so many options, why Choose Us
All Our Productsare Produced under Strict Quality Inspection
12-Month Worry-Free Warranty and Free Life-time Technical Support
Professional After-Sales Team

Specification:
Working Voltage: 5.0V DC
Interface: USB interface
Mechanical Switch Type: Blue Switch
Key Force: 60g¡À15g
Key Stroke Travel: 4.0¡À0.2mm
Key Lifespan: 50,000,000 times strokes

Package Included:
1*Mechanical Keyboard
1*Keycap Puller
1*User Manual
feature_bullets: 【Blue Switches】The switches are of the highest quality, tested for 50 million keystrokes,designed for longevity with greater durability and responsiveness. The Mechanical Keyboard offers medium resistance, crisp click sound, and precise tactile feedback for ultimate typing and gaming performance. 60 ±15g key force and 4.0 ± 0.2mm stroke travel.

【87 Non-Conflicting Keys & 12 Multimedia Keys】The anti-ghosting technology of Keyboard allows multiple keys to work simultaneously without confliction. 12 combinations of multimedia keys facilitate the operation of your work or game and improve efficiency.

【Durable & Water-Resistant】The top-grade ABS keycaps and brushed metal panel are extremely durable and abrasion-resistant. Water-resistant with drain holes. Protection against accidental spills provides extra peace of mind

【Ergonomic Design】Cascading keycap and ergonomic design fits your palm easily to prevent fatigue that stand up even during the most testing marathon gaming sessions like league of legends, Steam, Fortnite, PUGB, Overwatch, Call of Duty and other FPS Games
【Wide Compatibility】PC wired gaming keyboard is compatible with Windows XP/2000/VISTA/7/8/10 .Backed by 45 days money-back and 12-month worry-free warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,147 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
